page.title: 17CRANHAM CHURCH: UPMINSTER
page.content: All Saints is the{parish church of {Cranham}& like St. Mary's Magdalene at North Ockendon is the religious centre of what was a{parish of scattered farm {steads.}No community nucleated around the church except a farm & Hall. All Saints' parish has{grown from 201 {souls in 1801 to 6000.}The present {stone church dates from 1873}replacing the former wooden church: priests have served here since{1310. The church houses the grave of{Gen. {James Oglethorpe who founded the State {of Georgia USA}in 1733 & died in 1785. His family lived in Cranham Hall next to the church where he would entertain the famous & noble like{Dr. Johnson. The Hall still exists but like other large houses in the area has been rebuilt (1930s). Descendants still live locally but no longer at Cranham Hall.
